summary.para: Performs the actual display of UI for a handler or sync item when requested to do so by Sync Center.

param.name: hwndOwner
param.para: A handle to the window used to display the UI.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise. Returns S_FALSE or another error code if this method is called to confirm an operation, such as activating a handler or disabling a sync item, but that operation should not be executed.

remarks.para: The handler itself, not the UI, is expected to use the interface to notify Sync Center of changes to its state that come about through choices made by the user in the UI.

The following example shows the outline of an implementation of this method. In this case, the implementation is that which would be returned when is called with the SYNCMGR_OBJECTID_QueryBeforeDelete object ID.

summary.para: Exposes a method through which a sync handler or sync item can display a UI object when requested to do so by Sync Center.

remarks.para: Handlers implement ISyncMgrUIOperation to provide UI for a particular action. Each separate action (browse, schedule, enable/disable, activate/deactivate, and delete) requires a separate implementation.
A handler should only implement this interface for operations for which it wants to present UI.
The following summarizes the steps Sync Center takes to instantiate and use this interface.

item.description: Sync Center creates a separate thread for the UI operation.
Sync Center creates a new instance of the handler.

If the operation involves only a handler, Sync Center calls with the appropriate SYNCMGR_OBJECTID object ID to obtain a pointer to the ISyncMgrUIOperation that implements that UI object. For example, Sync Center calls ISyncMgrHandler.GetObject with SYNCMGR_OBJECTID_QueryBeforeDelete to obtain an object that is called to display UI when the user chooses to delete the handler, asking for a confirmation that they do indeed want to delete it.

If the operation involves a sync item, Sync Center makes a series of calls, including the following:
is called on the interface to retrieve an instance of .
is called to obtain a pointer to the instance representing the item.
is called with the appropriate SYNCMGR_OBJECTID object ID to obtain a pointer to the ISyncMgrUIOperation that implements the UI object.
Sync Center calls the UI object's method to display the UI.

remarks.para: By implementing the UI as a separate interface, the display of the UI can be performed independently of synchronization. ISyncMgrUIOperation should be implemented on a different object than either or .
If the user requests an action, then requests that same action again before the first has completed, the UI for the initial action is activated and brought to the foreground.
